text:
UNIVERSITY OF
'iMinnesota
GENERAL EXTENSION DIVISION
DEPARTMENT OF RADIO AND TELEVISION BROADCASTING
MINNEAPOLIS 14
June 13,1962
Mr. William Harley, President
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
Suite 1119-21
Dupont Circle Office Building
1346 Connecticut Avenue N.W.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Bills
Thank you for sending the NAEB comment opposing education¬
al station licensing fees.
I think it states the case very well. It is entirely in
agreement with my own memorandum to you on the subject some
months back, so naturally I would like it. In addition the
argument is skillfully expressed.
I hope we get what we want: I don’t see how they can
very easily deny it!
Yours sincerely
Burton Paulu
Director of Radio and
Television Broadcasting
BP: sn
cc: Leonard Marks
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
JUN 18 1962
AM
I
